snippet: The decrease comes after a change to the tests given by the Department of Education, which has been trying to address a surge in the number of students who qualified.
abstract: Number of children qualifying for seats in gifted programs in New York City public schools declined slightly in 2012-2013 after Education Dept overhauled its admissions process, in part to combat a recent explosion in eligibility; despite overall decline, however, the numbers of eligible children are still vastly higher than they were even as recently as 2008.
lead_paragraph: The decrease comes after a change to the tests given by the Department of Education, which has been trying to address a surge in the number of students who qualified.

headline.seo: Slight Dip in Number of Children Eligible for New York City’s Gifted Schools
headline.main: Slightly Fewer Children Eligible for Gifted Classes in New York
headline.print_headline: Slightly Fewer Children Eligible for Gifted Classes
